tone.name: Tone & Style

scaffolding.description: Break down tasks and provide support

precision.name: Language Consistency & Precision
precision.description: Make language clearer and more precise

example.original: How can you observe temperature changes in different states of matter?

example.modified: How can you observe temperature changes in matter?

consistent-terminology.description: Uses consistent, specific terms throughout the question

1. Explain what evaporation means.
2. Explain what precipitation means.
3. Describe how evaporation and precipitation are connected.

one-step-only.name: One Step Only
one-step-only.description: Reduces the question to focus on just one simple task

example.original: Describe how water evaporates and then forms precipitation as part of the water cycle.
example.modified: Explain what evaporation means.

provide-hint.name: Provide Hint
provide-hint.description: Adds a helpful hint to guide the student toward the answer

example.modified: Describe how water evaporates. Hint: Think about what happens when the sun warms water.

provide-model.name: Provide Model
provide-model.description: Provides an example answer to help students understand what's expected

example.modified: Describe how water evaporates and forms precipitation. Model: For example, when heat warms water, it can turn into a gas.

example.modified:
What is the main role of the mitochondria?
A. Store water
B. Produce energy
C. Control movement
D. Protect the cell

word-bank.description: Provides a list of words the student can choose from

The mitochondria help a cell by providing ______.
Word bank: energy, support, water, waste removal
